text: (upbeat music)

- At McGraw Hill, we
create digital products
that help learners across the world.
We are known as a trusted company

that's delivered credible
content for over 130 years
across the world.
And over the last 10 years in particular,
we have transformed our company
to be a digital ed tech powerhouse.
Over the last couple of years,

three out of four students
have changed the way
that they have studied.

And that is because they
are increasingly adapted
to a hybrid learning model.

And we see the impact of
that across higher education.

And we wanted to react and
respond to these students

that are rapidly changing
their study behaviors.

We wanted to provide our and
unlock our vast treasure trove
of content and to provide content in a way
that they are demanding and they want.
We knew that we needed to take inspiration
from applications and experiences
that were central to our students' lives.

Whether that was social
media, their fitness apps.

And that's what we have done
in a product called Sharpen.

And Sharpen does that by
providing curated content
and bite-sized learning for them

in a completely different
way that hasn't been seen
in the education sector,

through short videos and
a gamified experience

for our students, in a way that
they can track their process
and feel confident.

We knew that we wanted to
really attack this pain point
to unlock the benefit for our students.

And so we set out on what really
was an innovation journey.

The way that we undertook that
was really working backwards
from our customers' pain points.
We knew that if we wanted
to make something completely different,
we also need to think about our processes

and our ways of working
in a different way.

And so we reached out to
AWS as we were starting

the iterative journey very
early on into the process.

We were able to put new
processes to test out concepts
without spending much resources.

And we were able to
test it out on students

and to ensure that they loved
what we were about to design.

How we tweaked our innovation
approach was ensuring

that we were extremely and are
extremely lean and flexible.

Ultimately, 'cause we had
trust in that process,

we were able to create
a product in six months

that really, really resonated
with our student audiences.

Secondly, they were
able to help us in terms
of our overall architecture.
And that's really important,
because we are a large company.
We care very deeply about student data.
Security, stability, and performance

are absolutely critical for
us right from the get-go.
Immediately after launching Sharpen,
we felt the business impact straight away.
All of a sudden, we were developing
a much more closer relationship
with our end consumer, our students.

Over the last couple of
years, we've embarked

on an ambitious digital
transformation journey,

which has virtually changed
the way that we work
in every part of our business.
We've been able to see the result
of our digital transformation.

This year, we increased our
digital billings by 20%.

And what's even more
rewarding is that we're able

to invest more and more into
bold, ambitious products
like Sharpen that are changing the way
that students learn all across the world.
(upbeat music continues)
